author: News18
title: Navi Mumbai To Face 18-Hour Water Cut On July 18 For Pipeline Repair
text:
Navi Mumbai To Face 18-Hour Water Cut On July 18 For Pipeline Repair
Affected areas under NMMC jurisdiction include Airoli, Belapur, Nerul, Koparkhairane, Turbhe, Sanpada, Ghansoli and Vashi.
The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has announced an 18-hour water supply disruption in Navi Mumbai starting Friday, July 18. This disruption is necessary to carry out essential repair and connection work on the Morbe main water pipeline. As per the NMMCâ€™s announcement, the work is scheduled to commence from 10 AM on Friday, July 18, to 4 AM on Saturday, July 19.
The work involves linking a newly laid pipeline to the existing 1700 mm diameter Morbe pipeline, which supplies drinking water to large parts of Navi Mumbai. The affected stretch runs along Palm Beach Road in Nerul Sector 46, near Akshar Building.
Recommended Stories
This stretch has experienced multiple leakages in recent months, leading to water loss and disruptions. To address the issue, the NMMC laid a new pipeline alongside the existing one. Now, they have decided to connect the two.
As a result, the water supply will impact several key areas in Navi Mumbai. Affected areas under NMMC jurisdiction include Airoli, Belapur, Nerul, Koparkhairane, Turbhe, Sanpada, Ghansoli and Vashi. Localities that have direct tap connections to the main pipeline will also face a water supply suspension. In addition to this, CIDCO-administered areas such as Kharghar and Kamothe will also face disruption.
During the shutdown, there will be no water service on Friday evening, July 18, or Saturday morning, July 19. The water supply is expected to be restored by Saturday evening, but it will be at low pressure.
The NMMC has urged all households in the impacted districts to store sufficient water in advance and use it sparingly during the disruption. NMMC officials emphasised that this connection work is critical for preventing future leaks and providing a more stable water delivery system for the city in the long run.
â€œWe urge citizens to bear with the temporary inconvenience and support the civic body in completing this critical work on schedule and without delays and use water mindfully," an NMMC officer was quoted as saying by the Free Press Journal.
The officials further stressed that the scheduled work aligns with broader efforts to create gender-inclusive, sustainable and community-sensitive urban services.

Buzz Staff

author: Jacky
title: Looking for some activities during the school holidays? We have selected a lot for you
text:
Are you looking for affordable outdoor activities to keep the kids (or grandkids) busy these school holidays?
Weâ€™ve hand-picked a bunch of Gardening Australia Junior projects that are sure to tempt you into the garden and hopefully teach your budding gardener a few new facts along the way.
1. Build a birdâ€™s nest â€˜tentâ€™
Would you like some feathered friends to visit your backyard or balcony? Make a bird-sized â€œtentâ€ for local birds to visit, where they can pick up supplies to build their nests.
What you will need:
- A collection of dry leaves, twigs, hair and straw.
- An old birdhouse or nest, plus fun craft supplies to decorate it.
- A strip of chicken wire to make a cylinder that fits inside the bird house.
For full instructions, download the printable
 activities worksheet.
2. Prepare a pizza outdoors
Is there anything better than homemade pizza? There sure is! A pizza-shaped herb garden to bring your flavorful creation to life.
What you will need:
- A circular raised garden bed
- Reliable gardening tools such as shovels, trowels and a watering can.
- Good quality soil to fill the garden bed.
- Something to divide your garden bed into segments like a pizza (we use wood)
- Herbs! The kind that look great on top of your pizza. Think rosemary, parsley, thyme, oregano, basil, and river mint.
For full instructions, download the printable
https://live-production.wcms.abc-cdn.net.au/630911e3f5c7e31afbe9da4d066a37a7.
3. Plant a dinosaur paradise
Get roaring and create a sunny desert garden to play with dinosaurs.
What you will need:
- gardening gloves
- A garden bed or large pot placed in full sun.
- Good quality soil
- Plants that a) look prehistoric and b) like lots of sun. Think grasses, cacti, ponytail palms, pigface, and lithops (like imaginary dinosaur eggs)
- Toy dinosaurs (you didnâ€™t think weâ€™d suggest a real one, did you?)
- Optional extras: pebbles, sand for prehistoric â€œquicksandâ€, a water dish for a dinosaur watering hole, and a toy volcano.
For full instructions, download the printable
activities worksheet.
4. Make a fruit cake (very fruity)
Create a special surprise for your goats (or yourself) with a fruit cake made entirely of fruit.
What you will need:
- Variety of seasonal fruits. Citrus and stone fruits are great this time of year (and we used a watermelon as the base for ours)
- A knife to cut your fruit into pieces
- a large plate
For full instructions, download the printable
https://live-production.wcms.abc-cdn.net.au/1e43d890bf74905c9a63b2ef097604b3.
5. Build a bee hotel
Get â€œlivelyâ€ (weâ€™ll see you outside) by making a shelter for the native bees that visit your garden.
What you will need:
- A container for the hotel. This can be any cup, jar, clean can, or old cylinder you can find around the house.
- Hollow bamboo sticks that can be cut to the size of your container.
- Arts and crafts supplies to decorate your bee hotel. Think paint, thread, wire, fabric. In fact, you can even make your hotel look like a bee!
For full instructions, download the printable
https://live-production.wcms.abc-cdn.net.au/17ccf71db1bd3bed7eec2b55a01d5d34.
6. Make your own compost pot
Put on your wizard hat and prepare a special snack for your garden: compost!
What you will need:
- A cauldron (a pot, bucket, or anything similar you can find)
- Brown compost ingredients such as sticks, cardboard, paper or newspaper.
- Green compost ingredients, such as food scraps or green garden clippings.
- The most important thing is your best wizard outfit, like a magic hat and robe!
For full instructions, download the printable
https://live-production.wcms.abc-cdn.net.au/b155ded076d576177baff37a00ba0261.
7. Go on a spooky adventure
Intrigued by insects? Embark on the ultimate adventure to find the coolest bugs in your garden.
What you will need:
- adventure clothing
- Hat
- Binoculars
For full instructions, download the printable
activities worksheet.
8. Host a worm race
Make a transparent worm farm that allows you to see whatâ€™s going on beneath the soil as the wriggling worms compost their food and garden waste.
What you will need:
- Two clear containers, each with a tap attached.
- Brown compost materials: recycled paper and cardboard, dried leaves and twigs.
- Green compost materials: kitchen fruit and vegetable scraps and grass clippings
- Good quality soil
- Worms (you need special compost worms for a worm farm to do the best job!). Be sure to wear gloves when handling your restless residents.
For full instructions, download the printable
https://live-production.wcms.abc-cdn.net.au/c77b2b57579bbf0b808a8aa4d589e8da.
9.Make your own grevillea cordial
And after all that hard work, turn your gardenâ€™s native flowers into a sweet, homegrown nectar drink.
What you will need:
- A jug or container with water.
- A flowering grevillea bush or a bunch of cut grevillea flowers
For more hands-on projects to help children explore the wonderful world of gardening, visit the ABC Kids website or explore Gardening Australia Junior at
Youtube either I see.

author: Ashleigh Madden
title: Sydney recovering from coldest, windiest spell in 13 years
text: Sydney just shivered through one of the windiest and coldest 5-day streaks in more than a decade, as freezing southerly winds lashed the NSW coast for days. The cold and ferocious winds were directed over the NSW coast by a slow-moving Tasman Low, which was held in place by a stubborn high pressure system over southern Australia. The Tasman Low rapidly deepened on Sunday, July 28 and continued to impact the NSW coast until Thursday, August 1. The image below shows the low in the Tasman directing a brisk southerly airstream over the NSW coast on Wednesday, with frequent cloud and showers moving north onto the coast. Image: Himawari-9 satellite image at 8am AEST on Wednesday, July 3 During the five days to midnight August 1, Sydney Observatory Hill recorded five consecutive days no warmer than 16.5 Â°C, with gusts peaking higher than 45 km/h each day. This is the coldest, windiest spell Sydney has seen in 13 years. Some notable observations during this period are: - Sydneyâ€™s â€˜feels likeâ€™ temperature was â€“0.3Â°C at 9:50am on Sunday, July 28. - Sydneyâ€™s daytime temperature reached only 15Â°C on Sunday, July 28. - The overnight temperature dropped to 6.9Â°C early Tuesday morning, July 30. - Sydneyâ€™s mean wind speed peaked at 53.7 km/h and gusted up to 77.8 km/h on Sunday, July 28. - The prolonged period of southerly winds whipped up large and powerful surf, with Sydneyâ€™s waves peaking at 5 metres with a period of 14.9 seconds. The low has now moved away from Australia. As of Friday morning, the low was located near New Zealandâ€™s North Island. As a result, conditions are now easing over NSW. While winds will be weaker on Friday, it will still feel cold, with temperatures in the city feeling no warmer than 12-13Â°C this afternoon. On the weekend the city will warm up further to 19 Â°C, with mostly sunny skies and light winds. Weatherzone Business has grown to become the outright leader within the Australian energy market, serving wind, solar, hydro, trading, utilities and network companies. You canâ€™t control the weather, but you can gain precision insights to optimise your response. What lights us up is providing your energy business with tailored weather information to reduce your risk and keep you moving ahead of the curve. Our services cover all aspects â€“ from wind and solar generation to demand forecasts, wholesale markets to retail so, no matter where your company sits, we have solutions for you. We have worked closely with market participants to create products that meet the evolving needs of the sector, aiming to increase safety and profitability for our customers. Benefit from the timely delivery of accurate weather information, allowing informed and effective decision-making. To find out more, please visit our [contact page](https://business.weatherzone.com.au/contact-us?utm_source=website&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=may2024-b2b-contact-us) or email us at [business@weatherzone.com.au](mailto:business@weatherzone.com.au).

author: ScottK
title: Forum Post: RE: Generating Rent Roll Correct Amount not pulled
text:
We have generated a rent roll; however the amount is incorrect, but is entered correctly.
Sounds like there may be a problem with a date. See if the information from this article helps:
PM Generate Rent Roll charge is prorated incorrectly (sage.com)
I am also having a similar issue. For me Sage is changing a single tenant a slightly higher amount in January. Every other month it is charging the correct amount. The other tenants at the same property do not have this issue, it is just the one tenant. Is there anything else I can look at to troubleshoot my issue? When I run a rent through through to next January I see the same issue appear again.
I am also having a similar issue. For me Sage is changing a single tenant a slightly higher amount in January. Every other month it is charging the correct amount. The other tenants at the same property do not have this issue, it is just the one tenant. Is there anything else I can look at to troubleshoot my issue? When I run a rent through through to next January I see the same issue appear again.
*Community Hub is the new name for Sage City

author: Amaris Encinas
title: Gypsy Rose marks release from prison with Instagram selfie
text: Gypsy Rose Blanchard shares selfie on Instagram after release from prison [Amaris Encinas](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/5133245001/amaris-encinas/) [Gypsy Rose Blanchard](/story/news/nation/2023/12/27/gypsy-rose-blanchard-release-case-timeline/72038395007/) commemorated her first full day of freedom with a selfie. She [ took to Instagram Friday](https://www.instagram.com/p/C1cNGBvu7IK/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading) to mark her release from prison by snapping a quick pic of her smiling, writing â€œFirst selfie of freedom!â€ in the caption. Blanchard, who conspired with her then-boyfriend Nick Godejohn to [kill her abusive mother in 2015](/story/news/local/2017/05/10/gypsy-blanchard-everything-you-need-know-case/101499166/), was released from prison [early Thursday morning. ](/story/news/nation/2023/12/28/gypsy-rose-blanchard-release-thursday/72047355007/) She pled [guilty to a second-degree murder charge](/story/news/crime/2016/07/05/gypsy-blanchard-pleads-guilty-murder/86617662/) on Tuesday, July 5, 2016 and served about 85% of her 10-year sentence, spending a total of eight years behind bars for her role in the murder. She became eligible for parole in September. Blanchard also [ recently announced the release of an eBook titled â€œRelease,â€](/story/news/crime/2023/12/19/social-media-accounts-promote-gypsy-rose-blanchard-book-released/71966263007/) set to come out on Jan. 9. Hereâ€™s what we know about Gypsy Rose Blanchard. Gypsy Rose Blanchard coverage: [Gypsy Rose Blanchard's release from prison latest twist in shocking Munchausen by Proxy case](/story/news/nation/2023/12/27/gypsy-rose-blanchard-release-case-timeline/72038395007/) Who is Gypsy Rose? [Gypsy Rose Blanchard](/story/news/nation/2023/12/28/gypsy-rose-blanchard-release-thursday/72047355007/), who is Clauddine â€œDee Deeâ€ Blanchardâ€™s daughter, was made to believe she suffered from a wide range of medical ailments including leukemia, asthma and muscular dystrophy thanks to her mother. Gypsyâ€™s late mother was accused of having made her daughter appear to have a range of physical and developmental ailments, USA Today previously [reported. ](/story/news/nation/2023/12/28/gypsy-rose-blanchard-release-thursday/72047355007/) Dee Dee Blanchard, later said to have [Munchausen syndrome by proxy](/story/news/crime/2016/07/06/munchausen-expert-says-gypsy-blanchard-case-unprecedented/86763054/) which is a mental condition in which someone makes another person ill for sympathy or gain received disability payments and gifts from charities all of Gypsyâ€™s illnesses, that often led to painful treatment and procedures. Gypsy, who used a [wheelchair before it was discovered she could walk](/story/news/crime/2015/06/16/daughter-boyfriend-charged-murder-dee-dee-blancharde/28803189/), said she was desperate to escape her mother's abuse and sought help from her online boyfriend, Nicholas Godejohn. [Godejohn, who was was sentenced to life in prison](/story/news/crime/2019/02/22/nicholas-godejohn-sentenced-life-prison-blanchard-murder/2949249002/) for stabbing and killing Dee Dee Blanchard, traveled to Missouri on [ June 9, 2015](/story/news/local/ozarks/2015/06/15/greene-county-sheriffs-office-searching-mother-daughter/71236652/) to help enact the escape plan. He was reportedly let into the home after Gypsyâ€™s late mother fell asleep and used a knife handed to him by Gypsy to stab the sleeping woman 17 times, killing her before fleeing to his native Wisconsin, USA Today previously reported. Gypsy later told [ABC 20/20 news](https://abcnews.go.com/US/young-wheelchair-bound-woman-treated-illnesses-ended-prison/story?id=52138979) she hid in the bathroom with hands over her ears during the act. Authorities were contacted about a post on Dee Dee Blanchardâ€™s Facebook page dated June 14, 2015 that read, â€˜That B*** is dead!â€™ before her body was [ found in her home](/story/news/local/ozarks/2015/06/15/greene-county-sheriffs-office-searching-mother-daughter/71236652/) with multiple stab wounds. Before Gypsy was publicly tied to the murder, many Springfield residents were worried that she was also in peril. The bizarre nature of the Springfield murder made national headlines and became the subject of [documentaries](/story/news/local/ozarks/2017/05/10/prior-premiere-hbo-film-gypsys-father-and-filmmaker-speak-bizarre-case/101438406/) and [streamed television series](/story/news/local/ozarks/2019/03/20/the-act-hulu-dee-dee-gypsy-rose-blanchard-true-crime/3228086002/). When was Gypsy Rose arrested? [Gypsy and her boyfriend were arrested](/story/news/nation/2023/12/27/gypsy-rose-blanchard-release-case-timeline/72038395007/) on June 14, 2015 in Big Bend, Wisconsin. The pair posted two updates on Dee Dee Blanchardâ€™s Facebook page earlier that day to draw attention to her yet undiscovered body. How old is Gypsy Rose? Gypsy Blanchard was born July 29, 1991, making her 32 years old in 2023. How old was Dee Dee Blanchard when she died? Dee Dee Blanchard was born May 3, 1967, making her 48 years old when she was killed in 2015. Who is Gypsy Rose married to? Gypsy married Ryan Scott Anderson in July 2022.
